title: How to Make Seven Wishes Bars

steps.headline: Begin with 1, 9x13 inch pan and put a whole stick of butter in it.
Put it in the oven till melted.
Take the pan out carefully since it will probably be hot and sprinkle the 2 cups of graham crackers over the melted butter like a layer, evenly.
For the next layer, sprinkle the 2 cups of chocolate chips over top the graham cracker layer evenly.
Sprinkle the 1 cup of chopped pecans over top the chocolate chips layer evenly.
Then sprinkle the 1 1/2 cups of shredded coconut over top of the pecans layer.

After everything is layered, drizzle lightly 1 can of sweetened condensed milk all over the top of your layers and place in a preheated oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (176 degrees Celsius) for 10-12 minutes.
Remove the pan from the oven and allow to cool for 5 minutes then score the edges carefully and the top 1 quarter deep into squares.
steps.description: This will allow you to cut them easier when they are all the way cooled, instead of ending up with a brick slab.

steps.headline: Allow to cool in the refrigerator for an additional hour.
Remove from the refrigerator and cut all the way into squares.
Serve on your choice of plate or platter and enjoy!

text: Begin with 1, 9x13 inch pan and put a whole stick of butter in it.  Put it in the oven till melted.  Take the pan out carefully since it will probably be hot and sprinkle the 2 cups of graham crackers over the melted butter like a layer, evenly.  For the next layer, sprinkle the 2 cups of chocolate chips over top the graham cracker layer evenly.  Sprinkle the 1 cup of chopped pecans over top the chocolate chips layer evenly.  Then sprinkle the 1 1/2 cups of shredded coconut over top of the pecans layer.  After everything is layered, drizzle lightly 1 can of sweetened condensed milk all over the top of your layers and place in a preheated oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (176 degrees Celsius) for 10-12 minutes.  Remove the pan from the oven and allow to cool for 5 minutes then score the edges carefully and the top 1 quarter deep into squares. This will allow you to cut them easier when they are all the way cooled, instead of ending up with a brick slab. Allow to cool in the refrigerator for an additional hour.  Remove from the refrigerator and cut all the way into squares.  Serve on your choice of plate or platter and enjoy!
